hanzi-su-wiki:
隻

Значения

Один (из пары); счётный суффикс для судов

Мнемоника

Птица 隹, пойманная рукой 又 — одна штука.

Варианты

只

classifier for birds and certain animals, one of a pair, some utensils, vessels etc
классификатор для птиц и некоторых животных, один из пары, некоторая утварь, посуда и т. д.

heisig_chinese_memo: On Vessels that travel long distances, sailors often get quite lonely being one of a pair (the wife is at home). They keep turkeys on the vessels, but not for use as food. The lonely sailors take turns enjoying the turkey's crotch.
heisig_story: The key word indicates the Japanese generic term for counting ships. Its elements: turkey . . . crotch.
Keyword_KKLC:
ONE OF A PAIR
COUNTER FOR SHIPS
Keyword_KANJIDIC: vessels, counter for ships, fish, birds, arrows, one of a pair
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: суд, счетчик для судов, рыб, птиц, стрел, один из пары
koohiiStory1: On Vessels that travel long distances, sailors often get quite lonely. They keep TURKEYS on the VESSELS, but not for use as food. The lonely sailors take turns enjoying the turkey´s CROTCH.
koohiiStory2: Donald Duck is a big bird that does not wear pants. It´s good to use him as a mnemonic because he is a sailor, and this kanji is used to count vessels.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A turkey sitting on a stool is something every ship has in its crow's nest. That's why the universal ship counter is a turkey on a stool. Not a crow.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture yourself counting ships by pointing your finger from one turkey propped up on a stool to the next. You'll be the best ship counter in the world at this rate!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Once you become the best ship counter in the world everyone will think you are super sexy (せき)! Nothing is sexier than being able to count, and counting ships is the sexiest thing you can count.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine yourself, a sexy ship counter. Sexily counting ships. You go guy/girl/non binary person! So sexy!

Ru_trainchinese: zhī: (графема/сч.слово) один, единственный; счетное слово для птиц и некоторых животных; счетное слово для одного из парных предметов; счетное слово для небольших судов и лодок; счетное слово для сосудов
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the little bird (隹) again (又) counts ships
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: On Vessels that travel long distances, sailors often get quite lonely being one of a pair (the wife is at home). They keep turkeys on the vessels, but not for use as food. The lonely sailors take turns enjoying the turkey's crotch.
humanum_full_description_en:
A Bronze, Zhuanwen from " and " from " short-tailed bird " word like the shape of the hand of the fowler, and have extended the capture or hunting mean, " won " the beginning of the text. "Shuowen": "Birds have one. Cong also holds falcons. Holding one falcon means only one, and two falcons means double."

" Only " can mean alone, Tang Hanyu "Ji Twelve Lang Wen": "Two lives in one body, a single figure."

" Only " is also used as a quantifier. "The Book of the Later Han-The Legend of Fangshu-Wang Qiao": "So wait for me to come, lift Zhangzhi, but get a scorpion."
humanum_short_description_en: A Bronze, Zhuanwen from " and " from " short-tailed bird " word like the shape of the hand of the fowler, and have extended the capture or hunting mean, " won " the beginning of the text.
humanum_full_description:
甲金文、篆文從「又」，從「隹」， 字象捕鳥於手之形，引申而有捕獲或獵獲的意思，是「獲」的初文。《說文》：「鳥一枚也。从又持隹。持一隹曰隻，二隹曰雙。」 《說文》釋作「鳥一枚」，即單位詞義，應當是借用的。

　　「隻」可表示單獨，唐韓愈〈祭十二郎文〉：「兩世一身，形單影隻。」

　　「隻」也用作量詞。《後漢書‧方術傳上‧王喬》：「於是候鳧至，舉羅張之，但得一隻舄焉。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文、篆文從「又」，從「隹」， 字象捕鳥於手之形，引申而有捕獲或獵獲的意思，是「獲」的初文。

Character decomposition 字形分解 :
Compound 隻 from right-hand 又 yòu and bird 隹 zhuī C761 衹<祇秖> R08 只戠 A329 只[隻衹] simp 只.

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(- hand holding bird) (- "a" bird) (- one as opposed to two 雙)

Simplification rule : R08 只戠 A329 只[隻衹]

Simplification rule explained :
existing-char phonetic-phonetic 只隻 phonetic-phonetic 只衹 只 (but，just, simply, only) 隻 (to capture) 衹 (a kind of clothing, only)

Variant rule clarification :
衹 (only, merely, but, redish brown) 祇 <spirit of the earth> 秖 <ripening of grain>

甲金文、篆文從「 又 」，從「 隹 」， 字象捕鳥於手之形，引申而有捕獲或獵獲的意思，是「 獲 」的初文。《說文》：「鳥一枚也。从又持隹。持一隹曰隻，二隹曰雙。」 《說文》釋作「鳥一枚」，即單位詞義，應當是借用的。 「 隻 」可表示單獨，唐韓愈〈祭十二郎文〉：「兩世一身，形單影隻。」 「 隻 」也用作量詞。《後漢書‧方術傳上‧王喬》：「於是候鳧至，舉羅張之，但得一隻舄焉。」
A Bronze, Zhuanwen from " and" from " short-tailed bird" word like the shape of the hand of the fowler, and have extended the capture or hunting mean, " won" the beginning of the text. "Shuowen": "Birds have one. Cong also holds falcons. Holding one falcon means only one, and two falcons means double." " Only" can mean alone, Tang Hanyu "Ji Twelve Lang Wen": "Two lives in one body, a single figure." " Only" is also used as a quantifier. "The Book of the Later Han-The Legend of Fangshu-Wang Qiao": "So wait for me to come, lift Zhangzhi, but get a scorpion."

隻字的基本解释

隻
zhī
见“只1”。

隻字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhī］
［《廣韻》之石切，入昔，章。］
亦作“1”。“只2”的繁体字。
(1)鸟一只。
(2)指一个。参见“隻字”。
(3)单，单独。
(4)量词。
(5)通“雙”。

隻字的康熙字典解释

【戌集中】【隹字部】　隻； 康熙笔画：10； 页码：页1364第09
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?之石切，音炙。【說文】鳥一枚也。从又，持隹。持一隹曰隻，持二隹曰雙。【玉篇】奇也。【增韻】物單曰隻。【後漢·方術傳】得一隻舄。【?天子傳】載玉萬隻。　又【列子·力命篇】多偶，自專，乗權，隻立，四人相與遊于世，胥如志也。

隻字的源字形

字源演变：

甲骨文金文小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
隻字的起名意思

暂无。

[①]［zhī］
[The stone cut of "Guangyun", into the past, chapter. ]
Also known as "1". "Only 2" in traditional characters.
(1) One bird.
(2) Refers to one. See "words".
(3) Single, alone.
(4) Quantifiers.
(5) Through "double".

【Tang Yun】【Ji Yun】【Rhyme Meeting】【Zheng Yun】? The stone cut, the sound is hot. [Said the text] There is also a bird. From again, hold the falcon. zhī
вм. 只
Radicals: 隹, 又  (turkey, stool)
Meaning Mnemonic
A turkey sitting on a stool is something every ship has in its crow's nest. That's why the universal ship counter is a turkey on a stool. Not a crow.
Picture yourself counting ships by pointing your finger from one turkey propped up on a stool to the next. You'll be the best ship counter in the world at this rate!
Reading Mnemonic
Once you become the best ship counter in the world everyone will think you are super sexy (せき)! Nothing is sexier than being able to count, and counting ships is the sexiest thing you can count.
Imagine yourself, a sexy ship counter. Sexily counting ships. You go guy/girl/non binary person! So sexy!
